verses.verse: If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> shall steal <S%H1589><s%> an ox, <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a sheep, <S%H7716><s%> and kill <S%H2873><s%> it, or <S%H176><s%> sell <S%H4376><s%> it; he shall restore <S%H7999><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> oxen <S%H1241><s%> for <S%H8478><s%> an ox, <S%H7794><s%> and four <S%H702><s%> sheep <S%H6629><s%> for <S%H8478><s%> a sheep. <S%H7716><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> a thief <S%H1590><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> breaking up, <S%H4290><s%> and be smitten <S%H5221><s%> that he die, <S%H4191><s%> there shall no <S%H369><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%> be shed for him.

If <S%H518><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> be risen <S%H2224><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> him, there shall be blood <S%H1818><s%> shed for him; for he should make full restitution; <S%H7999><s%> <S%H7999><s%> if <S%H518><s%> he have nothing, <S%H369><s%> then he shall be sold <S%H4376><s%> for his theft. <S%H1591><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> the theft <S%H1591><s%> be certainly found <S%H4672><s%> <S%H4672><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%> alive, <S%H2416><s%> whether it be ox, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H5704><s%> ass, <S%H2543><s%> or <S%H5704><s%> sheep; <S%H7716><s%> he shall restore <S%H7999><s%> double. <S%H8147><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> shall cause a field <S%H7704><s%> or <S%H176><s%> vineyard <S%H3754><s%> to be eaten, <S%H1197><s%> and shall put in <S%H7971><s%> <S%H853><s%> his beast, <S%H1165><s%> and shall feed <S%H1197><s%> in another man's <S%H312><s%> field; <S%H7704><s%> of the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own field, <S%H7704><s%> and of the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own vineyard, <S%H3754><s%> shall he make restitution. <S%H7999><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> break out, <S%H3318><s%> and catch <S%H4672><s%> in thorns, <S%H6975><s%> so that the staches of corn, <S%H1430><s%> or <S%H176><s%> the standing corn, <S%H7054><s%> or <S%H176><s%> the field, <S%H7704><s%> be consumed <S%H398><s%> therewith; he that kindled <S%H1197><s%> <S%H853><s%> the fire <S%H1200><s%> shall surely make restitution. <S%H7999><s%> <S%H7999><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> shall deliver <S%H5414><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> or <S%H176><s%> stuff <S%H3627><s%> to keep, <S%H8104><s%> and it be stolen <S%H1589><s%> out of the man's house; <S%H4480><s%> <S%H1004><s%> <S%H376><s%> if <S%H518><s%> the thief <S%H1590><s%> be found, <S%H4672><s%> let him pay <S%H7999><s%> double. <S%H8147><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> the thief <S%H1590><s%> be not <S%H3808><s%> found, <S%H4672><s%> then the master <S%H1167><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> shall be brought <S%H7126><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> the judges, <S%H430><s%> to see whether <S%H518><s%> <S%H3808><s%> he have put <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> unto his neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> goods. <S%H4399><s%>

For <S%H5921><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> manner <S%H1697><s%> of trespass, <S%H6588><s%> whether it be for <S%H5921><s%> ox, <S%H7794><s%> for <S%H5921><s%> ass, <S%H2543><s%> for <S%H5921><s%> sheep, <S%H7716><s%> for <S%H5921><s%> raiment, <S%H8008><s%> or for <S%H5921><s%> any manner <S%H3605><s%> of lost thing, <S%H9><s%> which <S%H834><s%> another challengeth <S%H559><s%> to be his, <S%H3588><s%> <S%H1931><s%> <S%H2088><s%> the cause <S%H1697><s%> of both parties <S%H8147><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> before <S%H5704><s%> the judges; <S%H430><s%> and whom <S%H834><s%> the judges <S%H430><s%> shall condemn, <S%H7561><s%> he shall pay <S%H7999><s%> double <S%H8147><s%> unto his neighbor. <S%H7453><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> deliver <S%H5414><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> an ass, <S%H2543><s%> or <S%H176><s%> an ox, <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a sheep, <S%H7716><s%> or any <S%H3605><s%> beast, <S%H929><s%> to keep; <S%H8104><s%> and it die, <S%H4191><s%> or <S%H176><s%> be hurt, <S%H7665><s%> or <S%H176><s%> driven away, <S%H7617><s%> no man <S%H369><s%> seeing <S%H7200><s%> it:

Then shall an oath <S%H7621><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> between <S%H996><s%> them both, <S%H8147><s%> that <S%H518><s%> he hath not <S%H3808><s%> put <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> unto his neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> goods; <S%H4399><s%> and the owner <S%H1167><s%> of it shall accept <S%H3947><s%> thereof, and he shall not <S%H3808><s%> make it good. <S%H7999><s%>
And if <S%H518><s%> it be stolen <S%H1589><s%> <S%H1589><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5973><s%> him, he shall make restitution <S%H7999><s%> unto the owner <S%H1167><s%> thereof.

If <S%H518><s%> it be torn in pieces, <S%H2963><s%> <S%H2963><s%> then let him bring <S%H935><s%> it for witness, <S%H5707><s%> and he shall not <S%H3808><s%> make good <S%H7999><s%> that which was torn. <S%H2966><s%>

And if <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> borrow <S%H7592><s%> aught of <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5973><s%> his neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> and it be hurt, <S%H7665><s%> or <S%H176><s%> die, <S%H4191><s%> the owner <S%H1167><s%> thereof being not <S%H369><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> it, he shall surely make it good. <S%H7999><s%> <S%H7999><s%>

But if <S%H518><s%> the owner <S%H1167><s%> thereof be with <S%H5973><s%> it, he shall not <S%H3808><s%> make it good: <S%H7999><s%> if <S%H518><s%> it <S%H1931><s%> be a hired <S%H7916><s%> thing, it came <S%H935><s%> for his hire. <S%H7939><s%>

And if <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> entice <S%H6601><s%> a maid <S%H1330><s%> that <S%H834><s%> is not <S%H3808><s%> betrothed, <S%H781><s%> and lie <S%H7901><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> her, he shall surely endow <S%H4117><s%> <S%H4117><s%> her to be his wife. <S%H802><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> her father <S%H1><s%> utterly refuse <S%H3985><s%> <S%H3985><s%> to give <S%H5414><s%> her unto him, he shall pay <S%H8254><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> according to the dowry <S%H4119><s%> of virgins. <S%H1330><s%>
Thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> suffer a witch to live. <S%H2421><s%> <S%H3784><s%>
Whosoever <S%H3605><s%> lieth <S%H7901><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> a beast <S%H929><s%> shall surely be put to death. <S%H4191><s%> <S%H4191><s%>
He that sacrificeth <S%H2076><s%> unto any god, <S%H430><s%> save <S%H1115><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> only, <S%H905><s%> he shall be utterly destroyed. <S%H2763><s%>

Thou shalt neither <S%H3808><s%> vex <S%H3238><s%> a stranger, <S%H1616><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> oppress <S%H3905><s%> him: for <S%H3588><s%> ye were <S%H1961><s%> strangers <S%H1616><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>
Ye shall not <S%H3808><s%> afflict <S%H6031><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> widow, <S%H490><s%> or fatherless child. <S%H3490><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> thou afflict them in any wise, <S%H6031><s%> <S%H6031><s%> <S%H853><s%> and <S%H3588><s%> they cry at all <S%H6817><s%> <S%H6817><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> me, I will surely hear <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8085><s%> their cry; <S%H6818><s%>

And my wrath <S%H639><s%> shall wax hot, <S%H2734><s%> and I will kill <S%H2026><s%> you with the sword; <S%H2719><s%> and your wives <S%H802><s%> shall be <S%H1961><s%> widows, <S%H490><s%> and your children <S%H1121><s%> fatherless. <S%H3490><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> thou lend <S%H3867><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> to any of <S%H853><s%> my people <S%H5971><s%> that is <S%H853><s%> poor <S%H6041><s%> by <S%H5973><s%> thee, thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> to him as a usurer, <S%H5383><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shalt thou lay <S%H7760><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> him usury. <S%H5392><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> thou at all take thy neighbor's raiment to pledge, <S%H2254><s%> <S%H2254><s%> <S%H7453><s%> <S%H8008><s%> thou shalt deliver <S%H7725><s%> it unto him by that <S%H5704><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> goeth down: <S%H935><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> that <S%H1931><s%> is his covering <S%H3682><s%> only, <S%H905><s%> it <S%H1931><s%> is his raiment <S%H8071><s%> for his skin: <S%H5785><s%> wherein <S%H4100><s%> shall he sleep? <S%H7901><s%> and it shall come to pass, <S%H1961><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> he crieth <S%H6817><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> me, that I will hear; <S%H8085><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> I <S%H589><s%> am gracious. <S%H2587><s%>
Thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> revile <S%H7043><s%> the gods, <S%H430><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> curse <S%H779><s%> the ruler <S%H5387><s%> of thy people. <S%H5971><s%>

Thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> delay <S%H309><s%> to offer the first of thy ripe fruits, <S%H4395><s%> and of thy liquors: <S%H1831><s%> the firstborn <S%H1060><s%> of thy sons <S%H1121><s%> shalt thou give <S%H5414><s%> unto me.

Likewise <S%H3651><s%> shalt thou do <S%H6213><s%> with thine oxen, <S%H7794><s%> and with thy sheep: <S%H6629><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> it shall be <S%H1961><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> his dam; <S%H517><s%> on the eighth <S%H8066><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> thou shalt give <S%H5414><s%> it me.

And ye shall be <S%H1961><s%> holy <S%H6944><s%> men <S%H376><s%> unto me: neither <S%H3808><s%> shall ye eat <S%H398><s%> any flesh <S%H1320><s%> that is torn of beasts <S%H2966><s%> in the field; <S%H7704><s%> ye shall cast <S%H7993><s%> it to the dogs. <S%H3611><s%>
